questions.name:
The sides of a rectangle are in the ratio 4:3 and its area is 972sq.m
find the perimeter of the rectangle?
questions.explanation:
let 4x and 3x be sides of the rectangle
We know that area of rectangle = l×b
4x × 3x = 972
12x2 = 972
X2 = 81
X = 9
Therefore, length = 4x = 4×9 = 36m
Breadth = 3x = 3×9 = 27m
Therefore, perimeter = 2 (l+b) = 2(36+27) = 126m

questions.name:
The edge of a cuboid are in the ratio 1 : 2 : 3 and its surface area is 88 cm2.
The volume of the cuboid is:
questions.explanation:
Let the dimensions of the cuboid be x, 2x and 3x.
Then, 2(x*2x + 2x*3x + x*3x) = 88
= 2x2 + 6x2 + 3x2 = 44 = 11x2 = 44 = x2 = 4 = x = 2.
Therefore volume of the cuboid = (2*4*6) cm3 = 48 cm3.

questions.name: A 5 cubic centimeter cube is painted on all its side. If it is sliced into 1 cubic centimeter cubes, how many 1 cubic centimeter cubes will have exactly one of their sides painted?
questions.explanation:
When a 5 cc cube is sliced into 1 cc cubes, we will get 5*5*5 = 125 1 cc cubes.
In each side of the larger cube, the smaller cubes on the edges will have more than one of their sides painted.
Therefore, the cubes which are not on the edge of the larger cube and that lie on the facing sides of the larger cube will have exactly one side painted.
In each face of the larger cube, there will be 5*5 = 25 cubes. Of these, there will be 16 cubes on the edge and 3*3 = 9 cubes which are not on the edge.
Therefore, there will be 9 1-cc cubes per face that will have exactly one of their sides painted.
In total, there will be 9*6 = 54 such cubes.

questions.name: Find the cost of carpeting a room 13 m long and 9 m broad with a carpet 75 cm wide at the rate of Rs.12 per square meter.
questions.explanation:
Area of the carpet = Area of the room = (13 × 9) m2 = 117 m2.
Length of the carpet = (area/width) = 117 ×(4/3) m = 156 m.
Therefore Cost of carpeting = (156 × 12) = Rs.1872

questions.name: Find the circumference of a circle whose radius is 49 cm.
questions.explanation:
The option should be divisible by ‘11’ because ‘p’ has been used in finding its circumference.
One of the parameters is a higher power of 7. Thus, we need to find the only option that is a multiple of 7. If, however, we find more than one option that is a multiple of 7, we need to go through fundamentals.
Among the options, 308 and 407 are both multiples of 11. However, only 308 is a multiple of 7. So circumference of the circle = 308 cm.
We can test this as follows:
Circumference of circle = 2pr cm
= 2 × (22/7) × 7 × 49 cm
= 2 × 22 × 7 cm

then the weight of the pipe is:
questions.explanation:
External radius = 4 cm,
Internal radius = 3 cm.
Volume of iron
=22/7x [(4)2 - (3)2] x 21cm3
=22/7x 7 x 1 x 21cm3
= 462 cm3.
Weight of iron = (462 x 8) gm = 3696 gm = 3.696 kg.

questions.name:
A boat having a length 3 m and breadth 2 m is floating on a lake. The boat sinks by 1 cm when a man gets on it.
The mass of the man is:
questions.explanation:
Volume of water displaced = (3 x 2 x 0.01) m3= 0.06 m3.
Mass of man= Volume of water displaced x Density of water
= (0.06 x 1000) kg
= 60 kg.

questions.name:
A cube of side one meter length is cut into small cubes of side 10 cm each.
How many such small cubes can be obtained?
questions.explanation:
Along one edge, the number of small cubes that can be cut = 100/10 = 10
Along each edge 10 cubes can be cut. (Along length, breadth and height).
Total number of small cubes that can be cut = 10 * 10 * 10 = 1000
